amendment.description: To provide $60 billion over five years for greater health security for working Americans and their families through a combination of public and private efforts to expand quality, affordable health insurance coverage and cut health care costs by eliminating certain tax loopholes.

vote.text: Amendment SA 2803 not agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 43 - 53. Record Vote Number: 47.

action.text: Amendment SA 2803 proposed by Senator Lincoln. (consideration: CR S2626, S2645-2646; text: CR S2626) To provide $60 billion over five years for greater health security for working Americans and their families through a combination of public and private efforts to expand quality, affordable health insurance coverage and cut health care costs by eliminating certain tax loopholes.
Roll call votes on amendments in Senate: Amendment SA 2803 not agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 43 - 53. Record Vote Number: 47.
Senate amendment not agreed to: Amendment SA 2803 not agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 43 - 53. Record Vote Number: 47.
Senate amendment proposed (on the floor): Amendment SA 2803 proposed by Senator Lincoln.
